properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 5:01PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
West Virginia...

Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties.

For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River At Point Pleasant.
* Until further notice.
* At 4:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 42.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 40.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 43.7 feet
tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday
morning.
* Impact...At 43.8 feet, Route 30 and 62 near Rockcastle Creek, and
Ambrosia is flooded.
* Impact...At 43.8 feet, Water crosses Route 21 and 6 at Eight Mile
Creek above Ambrosia.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.7
feet on 03/10/1908.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive
cars through flooded areas.

This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood
stage.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued late tonight, or earlier if
conditions warrant.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning is now in effect until Monday, January 18
